Author: Catherine Ho
Headline: Why doctors' offices could become obsolete
Deck: Technological advancements are ushering in a new era of health care, eroding the long-held model of hospitals and doctors’ offices as the physical center of the health system.

Author: Trisha Thadani
Headline: Did you take your pill? Ingestible sensors can tell
Deck: Some experts say “smart pills” can help solve one of the biggest problems plaguing the health care industry: patients simply not taking their medication as prescribed.

Author: Catherine Ho
Headline: Shedding light on how antidepressants affect the brain
Deck: A Mark Zuckerberg-backed project could help revolutionize the way drugs for depression, schizophrenia and other psychiatric disorders are studied and developed.

Author: Benny Evangelista
Headline: How Apple AirPods could make future hearing aids cool
Deck: The emergence of headphones and earbuds as stylish, multifunctional accessories of modern life is helping usher in new possibilities for once-stigmatized ear gear.

Author: Dominic Fracassa
Headline: Why doctors hate electronic records — and what could change that
Deck: The health-care industrial complex has spent billions of dollars and untold amounts of time on electronic medical records. The payoff isn’t here yet.

Author: Catherine Ho
Headline: Are you sick? Just look at your wrist
Deck: Could a global epidemic be prevented by a sweat-tracking wristband? It’s possible — one day.

Author: Benny Evangelista
Headline: ‘Star Trek’ tricorders are boldly going forward
Deck: In 2017, the dream of a compact, all-in-one medical scanner is still decades — if not centuries — away.
